channel.title: Rotuer question, portfowarding
channel.description: Okay, i dont have any problem with running my server i portfowarded succesfully, but my question is, can there be more then 1 server running on the same router? because i have 2 brothers, we all just bought brand new laptops, and they want to run a server, so yea, if you know, please let me know as soon as possible, thanks!

item.title: Rotuer question, portfowarding
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“I am beast, post:7, topic:370231”][quote author=mikeandike link=topic=466348.msg3410463#msg3410463 date=1290643260]

could all the ports be opened as 43594? or do i have to make the ports all different as in, 5555, 43595
[/quote]they can all be open as 43594 and mind helping me via teamviewer making my rsps i dont know where i messed up

This is wrong, they have to have different ports such as 43594, and 5555 being the most common. I think you can try 43595 i’m not sure on that one though. As said above[/quote]
Fixed

Read full topic

item.title: Rotuer question, portfowarding
item.dc:creator: @I_am_beast I am beast
item.description:
@I_am_beast wrote:

[quote=“mikeandike, post:4, topic:370231”][quote author=s 3 3 m 3 link=topic=466348.msg3410461#msg3410461 date=1290643172]
could all the ports be opened as 43594? or do i have to make the ports all different as in, 5555, 43595
[/quote]they can all be open as 43594 and mind helping me via teamviewer making my rsps i dont know where i messed up[/quote]

This is wrong, they have to have different ports such as 43594, and 5555 being the most common. I think you can try 43595 i’m not sure on that one though.

Read full topic

item.title: Rotuer question, portfowarding
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

They cannot be the same ports.

Read full topic
